results.title: Who framed Roger Rabbit? (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Robert Watts, Frank Marshall and Robert Zemeckis
results.brief_description: A magical blend of live-acting and animation that comes off brilliantly due to the super effort by Bob Hoskins in playing to imaginary “co-stars” who were drawn in later. Hoskins plays Eddie Valiant, a has-been gumshoe in the ‘40’s film noir mould who comes out of a self enforced “retirement.” Someone is out to steal Toon Town from the cartoon characters who inhabit the magical land. To get their hands on the valuable property they frame its biggest star, Roger Rabbit for murder. Detective Valiant must solve the case and save the toons. Co-starring Christopher Lloyd, Joanna Cassidy, Stubby Kaye and Charles Fleisher.

results.title: Who framed Roger Rabbit?
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Amblin Entertainment, Robert Watts, Frank Marshall and Robert Zemeckis
results.brief_description: A magical blend of live-acting and animation that comes off brilliantly due to the super effort by Bob Hoskins in playing to imaginary “co-stars” who were drawn in later. Hoskins plays Eddie Valiant, a has-been gumshoe in the ‘40s film noir mould who comes out of a self enforced retirement. Someone is out to steal Toon Town from the cartoon characters who inhabit the magical land. To get their hands on the valuable property they frame its biggest star, Roger Rabbit for murder. Detective Valiant must solve the case and save the toons. Cast also includes Christopher Lloyd, Joanna Cassidy, Stubby Kaye and Charles Fleisher. Based on the story “Who censored Roger Rabbit?” by Gary K. Wolf and winner of four Academy Awards.

results.creator_credit: Centre for Educational TV and Laurie Lawler

results.title: Who dares wins: men of the Special Air Service Regiment
results.brief_description: The title of this film is the motto of the Special Air Service Regiment, or SAS as it is commonly known. These men of the Australian Army possess specialist skills which are utilised, together with further training, to mould an elite fighting force. Shows their primary role in reconnaissance, surveillance and harassment of an enemy.

results.title: Who dares wins
results.creator_credit: Sturia Leasing Ltd, Euan Lloyd and Ian Sharp
results.brief_description: Judy Davis stars in a controversial role as the leader of an anti-nuclear terrorist group. They are planning to attack the American Embassy residence in London to draw attention to their cause. Lewis Collins, posing as a court martialled S.A.S. Captain joins the terrorists in their attack on the embassy and subsequent kidnapping. Once housed in the embassy, Collins commences a combined air and ground attack on the S.A.S. The lives of the hostages are at stake as the S.A.S begin their rescue operation. Also starring Edward Woodwood and based on an original story by George Markstein.

results.title: Who cares?
results.brief_description: A personal impression of what happened to the people of the Abercrombie district of Liverpool when they were transplanted en bloc to the monstrosity of suburban, high rise planning. The residents regret the almost overnight obliteration of their old community and resent the unwelcome isolation of their new bewilderment.

results.title: Who cares?
results.brief_description: A dramatised recreation concerning the plight of a homeless teenage boy who has turned to prostitution in order to survive. Set in Sydney’s King Cross area the story tells of the efforts of some high school children to help him and attempts to explain the pressures that can cause a child to get into this situation. Financed by various companies and organisations in Sydney.

results.title: Who cares anyway?
results.brief_description: In this modern world there is little excuse for the squalor in which some of the elderly and neglected live. A group of young volunteers produced this film which takes away the glitter of the cities and exposes the utter wretchedness of Britain’s elderly and hopefully raise awareness of the situation.

results.title: Who cares about Jamie?
results.brief_description: Discusses the problem of metal health and suggests prevention as a solution. Follows James through a few hours of his young life and then analyses the reaction of adults involved. Stresses the role adults, particularly partner and teachers play: a child needs understanding at every stage of development if he is to acquire the capacity to face life.

results.title: Who can you trust?
results.brief_description: Points out the dangers of children accepting car rides from strangers. A number of situations are shown where a child is tempted to go with a stranger, and what children can do in such situations.
